Reviews.Title: “Small uncomfortable bed in a dark room”
Reviews.Author: Home_and_Dry_PSB
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge for a couples trip with a penthouse and were expecting something's really special. We were left quite disappointed with the drab dark room with a very cold aesthetic. It was too dark to do good nighttime reading and the place looks like it needs an update. The room was clean, but felt very sterile. We go to a lot of similar boutique hotels and enjoy modern decor, but this place lacked something. Worst of all was the bed. In a fairly large room, we had a tiny twin bed (labeled a queen, but definitely a twin-- we have a real queen bed at home). And the mattress was warped and quite uncomfortable. Not at all what we were expecting. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “12 nights without any complains”
Reviews.Author: TaisPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saint Paul was home for 12 nights and it was very close to main attractions, requested a quiet room and they provided one that I was satisfied (not facing street or main hotel areas), has a glocery store walking distance (Peel x NotreDame) called Metro Plus which is good if you get tired of eating in restaurants and want some prepared meal to eat in your room (had salads, veggie tray, fruit bowls ready to eat, etc). Hotel employees were always helpful and not nosy. Subway station is walking distance and you can get a day pass or 3 day pass (ask for the lLâ€™occasionnelle (http://www.stm.info/english/tarification/a-1a3jours.htm ) metro card so you don't pay for the card by itself) and ride as much as you want which is convenient for moving around different tour sites.

Reviews.Title: “Love it !”
Reviews.Author: isace m
Reviews.Content: Modern urban. The old Montreal environnement where Hotel St Paul is located, is the place you want to be for cool social life. Staff there can suggest best trendy places where to be and where to buy. Champagne, strawberries and decadent chocolate upon arrival! (we had reserved a special package) The room was spacious with big windows. We enjoyed !

Reviews.Title: “a fun and trendy stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: nadia g
Reviews.Content: First Stay in Saint Paul Montreal.Very nice from the beginning till the end!My room was very trendy and confortable with a nice view on Montreal.A lot of details to make you apreciate luxury and feel well: lights colors, decoration, fire place at the reception.The second floor is a great place : lounge to relax and have breakfast! Short and sweet my stay was perfect! The staff nice and helpful!very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Style Style Style”
Reviews.Author: Pawansahni
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about design and style and you should only choose this one if that is your priority number one as everything else average. The hotel has an awesome location which is right in the heart of the city. The room size was good although i thought the bed height was too high for me. I was on the 9th floor and had a decent view of the street. The room rent..according to me was over the top considering i paid 200 and did not even have breakfast in it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe but is anyone home?”
Reviews.Author: DrFoxNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the hotel design-wise. Our junior suite was unquestionably comfortable and spacious and we lived very happily there for two days. The public areas are splendid and although the hotel has been open for some time, the styling is still on trend and even ahead of the pack for Montreal. All good so far. BUT since we checked into the hotel for Christmas, it would have been handy if their website had indicated that they were planning to be rather 'out to lunch' service-wise for the holiday period. We had to hunt for someone to attend us at check-in as the reception was totally unattended. Later, when coming downstairs, we encountered members of the staff sitting around in the foyer scratching lottery quick pick tickets. Don't think I'm Scrooge, but standards ought to be maintained. It was all a little like that for the two days we were there. Be warned too that the hotel only runs partial room service: breakfast till 11.30 (and those folks WERE efficient), then nothing until 6.30pm when you can order room service dinner from Vauvert, a restaurant within (but operated separately from) the hotel. That food is GOOD. Too bad, however, if you want lunch. When I queried this hiatus with desk staff, they informed me that it was a small hotel (uplifted hand gesture), but at 100 plus rooms that is sufficient for full service. It's not a motel in Trois Rivieres. In the end, if you wanted full service, you might be better a few hundred metres along Rue St Paul at the Nelligan. If you want style and spaciousness and can forgive the lack-of-being-in-the-global-service-industry, then you can stay here. Who knows, by that time they might have hired a manager who trained somewhere other than a motel in Trois Rivieres.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, small rooms, poor staff service”
Reviews.Author: voldenuit
Reviews.Content: St-Paul has a great location and rooms that, while small, are extremely quiet, well appointed, and have proportionally very large bathrooms. Rate was good ($159 base rate excluding taxes). Staff service was a little mixed: nonchalant at best, confused at worst. Front desk checkout was haggard and confused and took a long time. Check-in (albeit at a very late hour) was not crowded but took about the same time to process. Service at the hotel bar, even during off-peak times, was indifferent, and left my colleagues and I frequently waving for service even though we were the only ones standing at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vibe, great location”
Reviews.Author: teeceeTO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Paul for just one night for business. Great location- close to Old Montreal as well as walking distance to Place Victoria and train station. Room was very modern -- not a lot of space for lounging, but suited my needs. Comfortable bed. I was on 6th floor and my window looked right into an office window across the street so had to keep my drapes closed. Overall a very nice experience, would stay there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Cory T
Reviews.Content: I was afforded the luxury of staying at the St. Paul for our company sales meeting. I planned the meeting with Brenda Dionne and she was amazing to work with. I was completely confident that everything would be perfect from the rooms to the food. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Thank you St. Paul team for making our stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and want to go back”
Reviews.Author: redsox367
Reviews.Content: Can't speak highly enough of this hotel. The location is great no more than 10-15 mins stroll from most places in Montreal that you might want to see, The room was big, well laid out and quiet. The decor took a bit of getting used to be I soon felt very comfortable in the relaxing and uncluttered space. Well worth a visit and they were doing a deal with 50% off the third night. Very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: our2cents
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel St.Paul in mid-September for 5 nights. The hotel is in a great area with tons of amazing (and unique) restaurants within a minutes walk. The staff were very friendly and quick to check us in at the door. We even make a mistake on our reservation and they were quick to fix it in our benefit. Our room was a large corner 2-bed room. The bathroom was big and lots of room for more than two people to get ready at the same time. The beds were comfy and the sheets were nice & soft. I liked that our room was trendy, but also not packed with too many things - which allows room for our luggage. My husband went to the hotel breakfast one morning and it was approx $16. It was rather disappointing and didn't even include any warm items - pricy for a cold breakfast. The hotel bar/restaurant on the main floor is classy - and the bartenders make amazing drinks. This is getting a bit picky, but the hallways are rather dark and the elevators were so small. I don't mind the dim lighting, but some people might think it's too "night club" looking for their taste. Overall, two thumbs up for Hotel St. Paul in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noisy guests spoiled our stay on penthouse level”
Reviews.Author: tdav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a few activities planned around the Old Port and wanted a conveniently located hotel in the area. Hotel St. Paul fit the bill perfectly. Additionally, it is only a 5-10 minute walk from Station Square Victoria, the nearest Metro (subway) station. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. As some previous reviews noted, however, the lighting is a bit low, particularly in the hallways...be sure to try and preserve your night vision by not looking at the light during your ride up in the elevator. ;) The hotel was kind enough to accommodate our request for both an early check-in and a late check-out. Unfortunately, our otherwise perfect weekend stay was marred when we were woken up at 5am in the morning by other guests talking loudly in the hallway and slamming their doors repeatedly. This ruckus went on intermittently for almost half an hour! Ironically, we had decided to stay on the penthouse level, thinking that it would be quieter!! If you are considering a stay at this hotel, I would definitely suggest checking other recent reviews to see if this is a recurring problem. Personally, although I really enjoyed my stay, I would think twice about staying here again, as I do not enjoy being rudely woken up at 5am while I'm on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel + Perfect Location + Friendly Staff = Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_and_Steve_NYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay here. I love Design Hotels and the St. Paul did not disappoint. The rooms and common areas were decorated beautifully and were spotlessly clean. Claudia in reservations was efficient and accommodating, Karla at the front desk went out of her way to help us with our numerous questions and requests, and Alixe provided lots of information -- always with a smile! The hotel is VERY close to some great restaurants and within easy walking distance of most things you'd want to do. There are lots of hotels to choose from in Montreal but I truly feel I picked the very best one! The St. Paul is a great find -- and the only design hotel in Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent space and room”
Reviews.Author: seantcollins
Reviews.Content: Quick to mcgill university and to the old port. Centrally located to st. Denis. Great bar and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Food”
Reviews.Author: DrJonz
Reviews.Content: Walk out the door to the right and down Rue St. Paul and you enter old Montreal. Boutique shops and cobblestones and horse drawn carriages and great restaurants. But if you don't leave the hotel, you'll be more than pleased with the Vauvert Restaurant and bar inside (and outside patio across the street for drinks). The food is so good (lunches too). Nice atmosphere and great staff. The rooms themselves are rather small, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, Cold Feeling”
Reviews.Author: DGCouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on on anniversary trip. St. Paul was in a great Old Montreal location, accessible to Rue St. Paul, the river, and historic sites. Our service was wonderful and the rooms were nice and clean. We only had a few complaints about the hotel. First, it had a very modern, cold feeling to it. Nothing warm and welcoming about it. Even the lighting in the halls was dreary. Our room did not have a single thing on the white walls. Second, the bed was SO hard as other reviewers mentioned. if you like hard mattresses, stay here; if not, reconsider. Third, at this price, I would expect free Wi-Fi and a continental breakfast. Rates are not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “O.k. Boutique Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TravelandLearn_11
Reviews.Content: Another trendy and dark-lit boutique hotel, very centrally located in Old Montreal. Great for exploring all the touristy sites, close to the subway stop, and to many excellent restaurants. The hotel itself is perfectly fine aside from the fact that it has little light. Our room faced a back alley with a dirty fire-escape in front of the window, so not much of a view. As there are so many great eating choices close by, we didn't bother about eating in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conceptually hip and wonderfully relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kitttykittty
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at the Hotel St. Paul. The staff were extremely friendly, well dressed, upbeat, and helpful. Be sure to tell the door man you like his lime green tie (personal joke). I have never slept on a more comfortable uber pillow top bed with fluffy feather duvet, fabulous down pillows, and great ambient lighting. You will love the huge bathroom with mega tub and yummy soaps and bath robes. We had the least expensively priced room yet still felt like a king and queen. Delicious little night-time chocolates come with the turn down service. Warning: internet is NOT FREE. That pains me when I am spending close to $250 a night at a hotel and am addicted to my online junk. The closest WiFi is two blocks away at Cafe Presse where you can grab a super strong latte and bagel for breakfast, or you can get your internet fix in the hotel business center on old Dell PCs.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is certainly cool enough, perhaps I'm not a good fit for it”
Reviews.Author: Olde_biL
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel St. Paul as the usual places I stay for business in MontrÃ©al were full. I found it OK and can only describe it my not meshing with the whole feel of the place. The decor was minimalist chic and I'm generally OK with that. For example I generally enjoy the Aloft by Trudeau airport. Perhaps it's a series of disappointments that have predisposed me negatively. These are, a lack of parking other than valet, unexpectedly having to pay for Internet access and not having breakfast included. The last two could be my own fault but were a negative surprise nonetheless. Otherwise, as many other reviewers have mentioned the decor is minimalist chic with some funky elements like the slanted floor mirror and the fuzzy White chair. The chocolate in the room is a nice touch, and the pillar in the room makes it distictive. All the appointments to the room seem fine, it was actually nice to see that there's an umbrella hanging in the closest (behind the tinsy winsy ironing board). The toiletries are fine but their presentation seems somewhat ostentatious/affected being covered by a clear acrylic box. I never did figure out what to do with the box besides set it somewhere out of the way. It was nice having a robe to use in the room and it's cute the way they arrange two robes in the bathroom. One bathroom bugaboo, there doesn't seem to be anyplace to hang hand towels. The desk is waaay too small. It's more reminiscent of a shelf than a desk. I put the phone on the floor to make room for a mouse pad. And there's the annoying crawling under to get to a power outlet thing. Also, it's always annoying having to pay extra for Internet access. There's a flat screen TV but, as usual, only analog cable. I don't remember if there was a fitness center or a business center, can't remember signage and certainly didn't go looking for it. I never did get a chance to to enjoy the part of town that the Hotel is in, perhaps that would have improved my overall mood. Still, for my next business trip to MontrÃ©al I'll revert to one of my usual hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We were so disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Robertrmpls
Reviews.Content: The hotel was billed as a charming old hotel in Old Montreal. In fact the facade was old but the interior was all modernized and cold. The staff were bell staff were accommodating but the host and front desk folks were not so friendly. Any questions seemed to be an imposition. The room was technologically up to date which required your room key in a slot to turn on the lights. The bed was uncomfortable and had a huge bolster across the headboard. The room was small. The restaurant was empty yet still required a reservation. The food was just fair. I asked the wait person for a carafe of ice water and was instead brought a Bottle of chilled French Spring Water. Although I id not wish to buy water I was charged $10 for it. It also made me ill and cost me a trip to the emergency room at our next destination. When we left the restaurant for a brief walk along the street, it was evident that not everyone was at the U2 concert as we were told when asked why the restaurant was not busy on a Friday night. All the other restaurant s on the street were packed. Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What an exceptIonal gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mjfun23
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, the sweetest most helpful staff, delicious breakfast, really happening bar and super comfy rooms, we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_My
Reviews.Content: Elegant design hotel. Comfortable rooms, large bathroom, not much traffic noise. Relatively friendly service. Wonderful location in Vieux Montreal, in the corner of the Paul Street (full of little galleries & restaurants), and McGill, near the attractions of the quays of the Old Port http://www.quaysoftheoldport.com/home.html. Stroll on the riverside, enjoy a sumptuous lobster roll (in the summertime) on the terrace of the Muvbox on the river, just down the road. Several interesting bars and breakfast cafÃ©s close by at McGill. Did not try the Bota Bota spa close by on the river - because of our schedule - but were very tempted indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelproGroup
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to Canada. We are new yorkers and I have a tough time finding hotels to meet my own criteria. This hotel was awesome from the moment we got there. It was very cool and hip but had zero attitude. The staff went above and beyond to guide us to great local restaurants and sights. The rooms were very clean and very well designed. It was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Nina181736
Reviews.Content: My experience with St. Paul's hotel was above my expectations. Their attention and patience was really appreciated when booking our business conference. I had the pleasure of having Eric as our point of contact and really appreciated his level of customer service when trying to book our arrangements for our group. I would definitely keep St. Paul's in mind when booking our next business function in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern great location”
Reviews.Author: Vacationist-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: The St Paul Hotel is located on Rue McGill right around the corner from Old Town. You can walk to any part of Old Town and any number of small bistros, coffee shops, and the Metro. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant, although pricey, was the best meal we eat in Montreal. We had a room on the 9th floor overlooking McGill. It was quite, comfortable and clean. The maid service was efficient and timely. The decor is modern and the only odd part is the hallway lighting - it's dark and red and almost hard to see in. We found breakfast to be convenient, but too pricey compared to local options located close by. WiFi is available but not free. We did not purchase WIFI, but instead used the free desk top computers on the 2nd floor for map searches, restaurant reviews and email. You can WiFi around the city for free. Overall the hotel was a good experience and we would go back. Look for the "sweet deals" on their web site for package discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TJNesbitt
Reviews.Content: I booked my team and clients into the St. Paul for business, but as alway, business in old Montreal means mixing with a healthy dose of pleasure. The rooms are tasteful, the beds very comfortable and the staff was most attentive. I would recommend staying at the St. Paul without hesitation. Tom N.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: meetingplanner06
Reviews.Content: We hosted our sales meeting at Hotel St. Paul and we could not have had a better experience. Staff was great. Location was fantastic. Easy for people to get around and see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Urbane and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Flatbushgirl
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at Hotel St. Paul on a visit to Montreal and the Jazz Festival over the 4th of July weekend. Our room was stylish, clean and comfortable and the service pleasant and not intrusive. In previous entries some have complained about the dark hallways...this is true, but I found it to be sexy and the rooms themselves are bright and sunny with a huge window. The hotel was quite a walk from the festival in downtown so we cabbed it a few times for under $10. However, the location in Old Montreal was great in relation to interesting sights and fabulous restaurants. Had a wonderful time at the St. Paul. It's a beautiful hotel and will definitely return when next in Montreal my very favorite city after NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Chic modern luxury in old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: RafeNewYork
Reviews.Content: First let's talk about the location. Right across from my favorite brunch place Le Cartet which is a must. Their own restaurant Vauvert has an outside bar where you can enjoy a cocktail in the early evening. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms have a deep tub perfect for soaking after a day of walking on the cobbled streets. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay at Hotel St. Paul!”
Reviews.Author: DtravellerHalifax
Reviews.Content: Always the best treatment, the best suite, the best restaurant, and the best Thursday night crowd in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern, elegant.”
Reviews.Author: bhs_wpg
Reviews.Content: Beautifully renovated hotel in a very modern stylish manner. Great breakfast buffet, good meeting rooms. Very classy place. Good location. Average rooms are small, but good, with generous bathrooms. Elegant feel. Average price, and a much nicer experience than a standard chain hotel. Hallways are narrow, dark, but the rooms are good.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and fun weekend at Hotel St. Paul”
Reviews.Author: Boricuadentro
Reviews.Content: We stayed Memorial Day weekend and were unexpectedly upgraded to a Jr.Suite (705)--a corner room well above the noise from street and lobby nightclub with a separate sitting area and television. The bathtub was fantastic and the bathrobes were great to curlup in afterward. After a long day walking and biking it was a dream to come back to the hotel and soak for an hour before heading out again for dinner and entertainment. The bed was very comfortable. I agree with other reviews about the decor--the halls are dark and the furniture in the room isn't comfortable except to sit on and tie your shoes. Boutique Chocolates arrived with turn-down service--a nice treat. But we didn't come to Montreal to sit in our room. It was comfortable, clean and safe--my top priorities. The lobby bar really gets going on the weekend with a great dj and we had so much fun dancing until early hours. So nice to just go upstairs after a 'night out' and not worry about getting a cab or finding our way back to hotel! We didn't try the hotel breakfast as there were other options nearby. We would definitely stay at the St.Paul again---it is just around the corner from old town and easy walking distance to the sights. About getting around: Cab it to/from airport. Around town if it's rainy the subway is great --we got a 3day pass, or if the weather is good use BIXI BIKES. You can rent a bike for $5/day and go wherever you want to go. We never had a problem locating a station to pick up a bike and it's so much easier, cheaper, healthier, fun to see the city from a bicycle. The city is very bike friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Guy-Charles
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to enjoy a lovely stay for over 3 weeks, and I can't describe how impressed I was by my experience. From the begining to the end, thuis boutique hotel as it all, warm reception, great location, great rooms, excellent food and amazing ambiance. I travel a lot arround the world, I wish I could get this value everywhere I stay. I selected the junior suite, and I recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kf_rich
Reviews.Content: Great place, warm atmosphere, modern boutique hotel, wonderful people and service, very nice room (good size, petit salon, comfortable bed). Free internet WIFI with good performance. Location is very convenient as it is in a quiet area and just 10 minutes walk to Saint Catherine Street. Very early wake up call + cab, with everything on time. I will be back next Friday. Richard K...

Reviews.Title: “Best design hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: geojoh
Reviews.Content: I've used many of the hotels in Old Montreal for business trips, but the St. Paul is by far my favourite and stands out in design and style. In particular, the meeting space in the hotel was fantastic. Seating was comfortable and the design very sleek. Quite a contrast to the usual uncomfortable dining chairs and unimaginative boxy meeting rooms offered in hotels nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great Service”
Reviews.Author: Martin282
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of old Montreal, this Hotel offer great service with a unique decor ans ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for an offsite business meeting.”
Reviews.Author: ajfriel
Reviews.Content: Was in town with some New Yorkers for a day of meetings, dinner and then drinks. Hotel St. Paul was accomodating and we enjoyed Vauvert for lunch as well as pre-dinner drinks. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “What a service!”
Reviews.Author: faudette
Reviews.Content: Our Company rented a conference room for our one day meeting including meals and everybody liked it! Well organized and very professional!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent food”
Reviews.Author: danrSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Paul for 10 days in April 2011 and loved everything about it. Rooms are very good size, bathrooms spacious,always very hot water available and the baths are huge. Free wi-fi throughout hotel and at very high speed too - better than anythign I've ever had in a hotel. Staff always helpful and very friendly. As we are at meetings in the hotel we ate lunch there very day and I ahev to say the food was outstanding, particularly the frsh fish dishes - Blue Marlin wonderful as was the Canadian pickerel. The hotel is in a nice part of the city, close to the watefront and within a short walk of lots of very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and trendy boutique hotel in Old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: lesvoyages25
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to this hotel after our reservations at our original hotel were lost. We were not completely enthralled at the beginning as its location was not where we had originally wanted to be.. We had wanted to be in the heart of the action on Saint-Denis. Nonetheless, once we arrived, we were immediately impressed by the beauty of the hotel. The outside was gorgeous and the inside was just the same. Very trendy and tastefully decorated hotel...even the smell of the hotel was beautiful (I know this may sound funny). Because of the mix-up of hotels and the receptionist seeing that we were still a bit upset about it all, she upgraded us for free to a Penthouse Suite...we were impressed! She also advised that their only form of parking was valet at a cost of $22 per day, but that we had free in and out privileges all day. She even gave us free "St. Paul" water while we waited! Once in our hotel room we found it to be very lovely! Once again it was very trendy and had very high ceilings with a large window that overlooked another part of Old Montreal. This is definitely a beautiful hotel to stay in if you are in Old Montreal...it is also a short walk away from many boutiques, shops, restaurants, etc... If we are ever again in old Montreal, we would stay here again. The excellent service we received matched the beauty of this hotel hands down! Good job Hotel St. Paul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Petaluridae
Reviews.Content: The Hotel in located in the Old Port of Montreal and walking distance to the Downtown core of the city. The staff are polite, friendly and accommodating. The room service menu is limited. I would have liked to have a little more variety. My room was very clean, I loved the bathroom especially the bath tub (it was huge). I also loved the giant windows that allowed maximum light into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Located between old, and new.”
Reviews.Author: Moose2711
Reviews.Content: Arriving at this hotel we required a room last minute and we were asked to wait, to wait, to wait. Having one person doing all the main desk tasks, the gentleman was kinda frustrated that we didn't have a reservation, however located us a decent room. The room was nothing special, cheap modern condo look, but all was very clean and equipped with great A/C. During the stay I entered into the bar/lounge area and wanted to ask a few questions. I patiently waited for the waitress to approach me, or even acknowledge me for that matter, but she continued to chat away with what appeared to be locals. I began to get frustrated and finally asked her my question and her response was,' I don't know', and then left it at that. I walked away, and she continued her conversation. I think this bar/tapas area is great for people looking to smooze with the locals and get your drink on, but serves no purpose to most guests. The breakfast area was nothing special, but did offer lots of magazines and newspapers to select from. Basically the variety would please a college student, cereals, a few fruit, deli-meat and sliced cheese. Upon checkout I asked the front desk guy, same one from check it, directions to Quebec city. He was once again very busy and handed me a small printed out piece of paper with vague details on it and said, 'this is all I know'. No effort to try and further help me, or locate anyone else who may be able to.

Reviews.Title: “Business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Aucoin
Reviews.Content: Great service, staff very accomadating and friendly. Room was setup perfectly. Great audio-visual setup. Perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hospitality, great staff and right in the middle of downtown Monreal :)”
Reviews.Author: petiteboite
Reviews.Content: We had a good trip for the birthday. All the staff were pefect and very nice. It was very clean, all the room was perfet for us. They made good recommandation for winning and dinning just walking distance from the Hotel. A trip we have to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Swordfish27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to escape the hectic holiday season back home and whisk ourselves away to Montreal. I, myself work for a 4 diamond boutique property back home and truly like the attention to the fine details the management and staff of boutique hotels provide their guests and for that reason alone is why we chose to stay at the St-Paul. The St-Paul is very conveniently located in Old Montreal and was walking distance to so many restaurants and shops. We parked the car for the three days we were there. I can't wait to return later this year. Thank you to the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: argnyc
Reviews.Content: Great location in Old Montreal. Great boutique hotel with much personality, but could use more warmth in staff service. Otherwise, great stay with wonderful continental breakfast in second floor and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Old Montreal, but the interior decoration is trying too hard.”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the St. Paul for a couple of days. The location was really great as the hotel is within walking distance to all of the bars, restaurants, and art galleries in Old Montreal. The hotel isn't in the middle of Old Montreal, but its very close to all that it has to offer. Amenities: The continental breakfast that's offered with the room was pleasant, included eggs, and several different types of bread/croissants, cereals, juices and coffee. We were also offered complimentary valet parking during our stay, which was a nice perk. We had to inquire about this deal though (we saw it on their website), it wasn't readily offered during our inquiry of hotel availability with the front desk staff. Valet staff and front desk personnel were extremely friendly. Guest Room: The guest room has a lot of closet space with room to place our things and a minibar stacked with lots of snacks and alcohol. Our bathroom was big, though the sink was very shallow and didn't properly drain. The bed itself wasn't entirely comfortable, but OK. As a person who likes a lot of pillows and nice linens, I wasn't all that satisfied with the bed. But, we had a decent night's sleep. Free internet worked well in the guest room. TV had lots of stations- both American and Canadian. The decoration throughout the hotel is very modern, but we found the decoration in the guests rooms to be a little bit jarring (though we recognize this is just our aesthetics). There is extremely low lighting in the elevators and the hallways, again, this is an effort to be modern, but its a bit much. One downside during our stay (over a weekend) is that the hotel turns into a nightclub on the first floor on the weekends, so the lobby was full of party-goers late at night. You could hear the music from the nightclub through the elevator, so that might be an issue for those staying on the lower floors (we were on a higher floor). Its also kind of annoying to have to push through people standing in line waiting to get into the club to get into the hotel later in the evening. Overall, the St. Paul is a good hotel, we might consider going back, but would be more interested in a cozier room. We would definitely recommend to travelers who like modern-looking, posh hotels and of course, to those interested in easy access to Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Historic St. Paul”
Reviews.Author: rjrstark
Reviews.Content: A good walking distance to anywhere old downtown. Trendy Upscale environment and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Meetings/travel”
Reviews.Author: Shawnee_10
Reviews.Content: I organized an event at the St.Paul in November for a group of executives. Everything was excellent. I reserved a meeting space which was really spacious with all the amenities you would want. I didn't have to worry about anything because the event coordinators took care of everything and were always available to answer my questions. The rooms were also beautiful and all the guests really enjoyed their stay. I would choose this hotel again for business or leisure because the prices are competitive and the quality is better than the other places I visited in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Our business meeting was a success”
Reviews.Author: Ginette_dumontier
Reviews.Content: I organized a business planning session at Hotel St-Paul in November 2010. Being from Montreal I suggested that we do it downtown and what a great choice Hotel St-Paul was. All my requests were met. The staff is absolutely amazing, delivering eveything I demanded and more. With over 25 participants, all staying at the hotel for one night and 2 days of business meetings, everything had to be perfect and it was. Thank you to all the management and staff at Hotel St-Paul for making me look good by being so nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual Hotel”
Reviews.Author: excobra_driver
Reviews.Content: The website makes it look very nice. The heavy curtains in the lobby which hide the elevators is the first unusual thing you see. Check-in was good. Steping into the dark gothic-like elevator is little unsettling but when you step off the elevator, the dark hall with red lighting is very strange. Room was bright and modern looking. They use the room key to turn on key lights in the room, but several lights are not a part of that system and left on for your arrival. Seems a waste to have more than one light left on. The continental breakfast was reasonable. Location wise, it is close to the restaurants and shopping in old Montreal. You pay for an average boutique experience. Every outgoing call is charged.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: SmythB
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for the weekend when we were in Montreal celebrating my birthday. The hotel was beautiful and the location was great. The room was swanky and well decorated. The bathroom was large with a large soaker tub that was fabulous. The staff were very friendly. and from the hotel we walked all over old Montreal and even over to St. Catherine for shopping. The valent parking was well priced and very convenient. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jgoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a great Fall promotion that made it a very appealing choice for a weekend stay. We loved staying in Old Montreal, which is great to walk around and an easy cab ride to other downtown destinations. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms clean and modern. They offer a complimentary continental breakfast and internet access. There is a popular restaurant and bar on the first floor, so it is not a quiet place to be on a Friday or Saturday night, but we couldn't hear anything from our room (8th floor). The service was a bit unpredictable - it was very good when we called to book and had restaurant inquiries and when we checked in, but the service when it came time to check out was lacking. We were mistakenly charged for parking and it was very slow to rectify the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but try the beds before you settle in!”
Reviews.Author: akboss123
Reviews.Content: The St.Paul was a mixed experience for us. From the moment we arrived at the front doors we were staggered by how beautiful the building was. Built in 1906 and maintaining all the outward appearance and detail of that age, it is a breathtaking appearance. Inside we were greeted warmly by staff who spoke flawlessly in English or French, and offered immediate and pleasant assistance. The interior design was almost as impressive as the exterior, painting a stark contrast of modern design with the classic outward appearance of the building. The room (ours was a Superior Queen, most are) was generously sized with large bright windows, and the room was ready with classical music playing softly in the background. So you're wondering, what's the bad part? Well, the bed and pillows in our room were entirely uncomfortable. Neither myself or my wife were able to get a decent night's sleep on the bed as it was hard as a rock, and the pillows were similarly made of what seemed to be R40 insulation. It's difficult to down-rate such a beautiful place, perhaps it was just 'our' room - it was after all an 'ice' theme. Each floor has a theme incorporating elements of the Earth, so some floors are 'ice' that feature blue lighting outside the rooms and the interior dÃ©cor is inspired by light glassy surfaces and cool colours. There are also 'fire' rooms, and I believe there might be Earth too. The included continental breakfast was delicious, offering 5 types of fresh bread, 4 types of fresh fruit (Cantaloupe, Watermelon, Honeydew and Pineapple), fresh or packaged yogurt, a selection of croissants or chocolate-chip danishes, and 3 types of delicious cheese. The St.Paul is also in an excellent location relative to old downtown Montreal, close to lots of good restaurants and attractions. We ate near the hotel most evenings (Indian place around the corner is brilliant, as is Holder), and took the metro up to the Jean Talon market. Staff was very friendly, accommodating all of our requests effortlessly for maps and information. One thing, because its an old building the rooms seem to have an older drainage system - the bathroom has an open drain in the center. Part way through our stay our room started to smell like sewer. My wife has apparently seen this before and just poured several litres of water down the drain and the smell disappeared, so no biggie. This is after all a classic building - if you want the style, you have to live with some of the drawbacks of older architecture. Aside from our uncomfortable bed the stay was awesome. Perhaps if we had complained like some travelers love to do we could have been moved or even 'promoted' to a better room. We have traveled many times staying in just hostels so we weren't about to criticize and just made do. If you do have problems with the comfort of the bed I'm sure the staff would happily change your room, so overall I'd give the St.Paul a great review.

Reviews.Title: “nice without blowing my sock”
Reviews.Author: kissycanada
Reviews.Content: Well the facade was amazing and with the positioning on night time spotlights, the building looked very impressive especially when it got dark. However once we arrived at our room, it seemed as though a lot of the character had been removed from the interior. Granted the hardwood floors were nicely stained a dark expresso colour, the ceilings were high and expansive,and the bathroom was well laid out with a great soaker tub, there was however something bland and sterile about the feel of the place. The breakfast was simple but with enough fruit/cheese/bread/hard boiled eggs/cereal to get full on. The location was fine and within walking distance to a lot of attractions. Anyway all in all a nice experience but way off from the best place I've stayed in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and sophisticated but not pretentious.”
Reviews.Author: BAP111
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel in the great neighbourhood of Old Montreal. The outside facade of the building is stunning and the interiors are creative, fun and elegant. Highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you can't see in the pictures...”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Eh_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel for a long-ish weekend to visit the Jean-Talon Market and the Easter Island exhibit. As advertised: * Located steps from Old Montreal - very convenient * Friendly + helpful staff * Clean and BEAUTIFULLY appointed rooms (the pictures don't lie - the rooms look that good!) * Continental breakfast was very generous * Free Internet What you can't see: Aforementioned beautifully appointed room had possibly the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept on (not firm but HARD) Because of the bed - I give this hotel a fail however if this kind of thing isn't your concern, go ahead a book it. If you are in Montreal, should you really be sleeping ?!??!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: SYNERGYINTERNATIONAL
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great Location in the Old Montreal, Very close to the port, Old City, Artist area e very close to the shopping area. Everythink can be reach in less then 10 minutes walking. Hotel is very elegant and the staff very efficent and nice with clients. Restaurant is very good, from food to wine.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, hip hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Bellaf52
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly. The young reception staff offered good restaurant suggestions and were generally very helpful. The room was well-appointed and very clean. We loved the dark hardwood floors, canopy beds, and large bathroom. The buffet breakfast which was included offered very good variety in a whimsically colourful room. The formal restaurant and bar is a hopping place on week-ends. Hip and chic without the attitude. I really liked this place and would definitely return. Only very minor aesthetic aspect I disliked was the reddish-hued lighting in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable!”
Reviews.Author: rlimagon
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice boutique hotel in a charming area of Montreal. Amazing modern and spacious rooms, spotless bathrooms and friendly staff. Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A Place & Space To Be in Luxury”
Reviews.Author: NicolasAdeline
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in a deluxe suite at the hotel with my girlfriend to just enjoy some quality time together and really enjoyed the clear, light and luxurious ambiance of the suite. Large white and cream coloured curtains created a particularly lovely feeling throughout the rooms and the entire ambiance in the hotel from the lobby through the sparsely lit elevator to the suite itself was an enticing world to enter. Location is excellent on the corner of the of the main and prestigious streets McGill and St. Paul and around the hotel and within the hotel itself there is a nice balance between being trendy and an exclusive location with lots happening at the hotel's restaurant VauVert and on the other hand quiet and private enough to enjoy one's self and to get away from it all. My favourite hotel, reminding me a bit of my stay at the Hotel Mercer in New York. Elegant, sophisticated. Extremely cool. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine_barbados
Reviews.Content: From all the hotels I stayed in, whether in Europe or the U.S., no doubt St. Paul hotel is the most refined, with a majestic outside look and modern interior design. Delicious rich complimentary breakfast is served and they give free high speed internet. The staff, from the General Manager, to the administration, reception, valet and housekeeping, everyone in the hotel was helpful and friendly. The rooms are elegant, very clean and offering all comfort, with a neat, attractive bathroom and nice bed. We had a lovely view of Youville Square. There is a charming restaurant at this hotel named â€˜â€˜Vauvertâ€™â€™. One of the big advantages is location. Rue St. Paul was beautiful with all the shops and restaurants lit up and only 10 minutes to the harbour boardwalk with so many attractions. In general, the hotel is gorgeous. We really enjoyed our weekend in this hotel and would definitely recommend it to other vacation travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: HoyaEsq
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant about the St. Paul as I favor another hotel in Montreal that was unfortunately booked solid. I am happy to say I have a new favorite hotel in Montreal. The St. Paul has hit all the right points - clean, modern and well tended rooms and facilities, friendly and helpful staff, and a great price point. I am still not completely sold on the location, but with taxis so easy to find it was not a problem (I usually like to walk everywhere.) The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, arranging a reservation at the awesome Queue de Cheval steakhouse when my own efforts proved fruitless, helping plan out a full day of sightseeing complete with maps and recommendations, even giving away the location of the best Poutine in all of Montreal. We'd stay again without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm service and beautiful decor!”
Reviews.Author: Lilixuxu
Reviews.Content: Great trendy experience... Amazing supper-club type restaurant field with beautiful people! Good food, load music... Not a place for a romantic dinner though... Amazing lobby and very professional personel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experence”
Reviews.Author: jmable
Reviews.Content: Very unique, upscale establishment. The best place to stay in Old Montreal. Convenient, Great dining and entertainment.. Friendly, professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy minimalism in a solid four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricaLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel St. Paul for one night in August 2010. We would return in a heartbeat. The hotel offered a wonderful location, friendly staff, and an appealing minimalist dÃ©cor enhanced with attention to detail that made for an atmosphere that was simultaneously chic and cozy. There was a bit of confusion regarding parking, as when we first arrived, the doorman indicated we could park in a lot around the corner if we didnâ€™t want to use valet parking (we generally avoid valet parking so we can easily get items from our car or leave things there as needed). When we checked in, we were told that this lot was for hourly self-parking only. My husband therefore brought the car back to the front of the hotel for the valet. Oddly, we later found that the valet service parks the cars in the same lot we had originally parked in! So if you need to access your valet-parked car, step out of the hotel, head right, and take your first right, and the lot is on the left (the front desk will arrange for a parking attendant to let you into your car if you only brought one key). The cost is $25 per night for the valet parking with taxes, and this covers 24 hours. Thus, we paid only $25 for our entire time in Montreal, even though we checked out of the hotel before noon but stayed in the city until about 3:00 pm. We booked a â€œstandard guest roomâ€� through booking.com. Though the hotelâ€™s website included no such room category, the description for this room type on booking was identical to that for a more costly â€œsuperior queenâ€� option also offered on booking and directly through the hotel. We checked in around 4:00 with an incredibly friendly reception staff member and were assigned to room 701. The seventh floor was lit with red lights (a bit too reminiscent of Amsterdamâ€™s RLD, to be honest!), but other floors we saw had a more attractive blue lighting. As others have said, the hallways and elevators are dark, but they were by no means dreary. Our room was wonderful. It felt spacious and loft-like, with a large column creating architectural interest and depth. Iâ€™m including photos rather than trying to describe the appearance. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The only complaint I had was that the pillows were of the synthetic down variety that clump up and become hard. Had we been staying another night, I would have inquired about the availability of other pillow types. Also, there was no alarm clock, so be sure to bring an alarm if you need one (although we never turned on the TV, which may have had something programmable). French music played on the dated shelf music system upon our arrival â€“ most people these days probably donâ€™t carry cassettes (!) and CDs with them, and I didnâ€™t see an aux-in outlet for an iPod/mp3 player. The in-room safe was very large and easily accommodated a netbook and numerous other items. The digital thermometer quickly adjusted the room temperature to suit my whims (great A/C when we arrived on a warm afternoon, plenty of heat when the night turned cold and rainy). We stayed on a Sunday night, a rainy one at that, so there wasnâ€™t much going on in the city and we found ourselves back in our hotel room by about 10 pm. It was a perfect night for a bath in the giant soaking tub (that easily accommodates two). The hotel-provided shower gel worked perfectly as bubble bath, and the â€œcalmingâ€� lotion lived up to its name. The hotel also provided bathrobes, shampoo, conditioner, multiple bars of soap, a shoeshine cloth, shower cap, q-tips, and cotton balls. Turndown service included delicious handmade chocolates sealed with a wax stamp, accompanied by a note regarding the weather forecast for the following day. Although the activity in the lobby when we came through at 10 pm suggested there was some kind of event going on (not sure if it was at the hotel or if a group was staying there and going out elsewhere), we did not hear any noise in our room. There were newspapers outside nearly all of our neighborsâ€™ doors in the morning, so there were definitely other guests on our floor. We ate the included continental breakfast on the second floor in what appeared to be part of a conference/event space. The items were standard (yogurt, fruit, cereal, bread, and pastries along with coffee and a couple of fruit juices) but tasty. The breakfast room was a pleasant space with lots of natural light and a mix of tables and lounge couches. It was rather busy but not crowded. In terms of location, we liked being near the edge of Old Montreal for easy access on foot to much of the city without being surrounded by the increasingly large tourist crowds found the further into the old city one ventured. We werenâ€™t in town for long, but we were able to walk everywhere we went. Overall, I was struck by how the St. Paul managed to combine aesthetically-pleasing minimalist design with small details (e.g., soaking tubs, a lobby fireplace, friendly staff, and nicely-scented toiletries) that made our stay very cozy on a cold, rainy night. I would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: cecile155032
Reviews.Content: Thatâ€™s my second time at Hotel St. Paul. It is a unique place filled with culture and style and my deluxe suite looks like a New York style apartment. I love the coach, and the curtains around the bed. I really liked the small touches like a small box chocolates, newspapers and bottles of water on a beautiful dark brown wood tray and the original presentation in the bathroom. The food at hotel restaurant â€œle Vauvertâ€� is excellent. The staff is great and always very helpful, and a very good continental breakfast is served. If you are looking for small hotel with a unique and tasteful design this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Lamothe4183
Reviews.Content: That's was my first time there, and we had a great moment there. First we had a service like you can compar with a bellagio in Vegas or the Trump Plaza they treat you like a family member!! Then the room are so nice, like a kind of New-York style. I suggest to you to spend a couples days off at the St-Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Run for the Hills”
Reviews.Author: teabag46
Reviews.Content: The worst Hotel I ever stayed in, the desk clerk checked me in without once making eye contact or welcoming me in any way,the room was dirty, previous guest left clothes in room ( missed by maid) room quality resembled my kids dorm room, the bar was rented to a function so we were unable to meet friends for a cocktail, and the 2nd floor lounge was also rented out to a private party. No turndown service 2 worn towels and no change of linens as no turn down. The breakfast rivalled that of a holiday in Express. This place is so busy attempting to be trendy they have forgotten their business, guest service zero. I actually tried to get a room at the Vogue where we usually stay. (highly reccomended) and would cheerfully have paid not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Guy AndrÃ©'s review " its all in Glamour"Refreshing Hotel and lounge very inspirational and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: guyndr
Reviews.Content: Great experience. The staff was great and always very helpful. Would definitely come back and refer to friends and family. I loved how central this Hotel was in relation to all of the attractions in Old montreal. Our room was gorgeous, the housekeeping staff were very efficient. If i were to rate this hotel; it would be a definite 10! oh! I almost forgot! the location was a straight shot from the downtown, there was no way to get lost! WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR? We will be returning to this Hotel in September 2010. Nightlife is great, the Vauvert Restaurant is also JETSET appealing and tastefull.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Sue_From_Toronto
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal quite often for business and the St. Paul Hotel has been my home away from home for the past four years. The spacious rooms with high ceilings, large windows, comfortable beds and big soaker tub make it very easy to relax when needed. The access to complimentary Wi-Fi, the business centre and/or lounge areas allow me other areas of the hotel to utilize aside from the room if needing to work or surf the web. With its fabulous location in Old Montreal, it allows for a terrific morning run and leisurely strolls to the nearby restaurants, bars, cafes, shopping or simply exploring the old city and port. The metro and train station are also in walking distance which is most convenient when I opt to take the train to/from Toronto instead of flying or wanting to visit friends or explore other areas of Montreal. Since 2006, I have been enjoying the hotels consistent professional and exceptional customer service, location, comfort, style, chic atmosphere and the wonderful morning breakfast â€¦always recommended to our business clients when they too are visiting â€¦â€�thank youâ€� and keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sarmufmaf
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family trip to Montreal. During our visit we stayed at hotel St. Paul located within walking distance from the old town,down town and the train station.Upon check in , we were greeted by the staff in the front desk who offered us a very personal service throughout our stay.If you are looking for small hotel with a unique design this is the place for you. We stayed at a deluxe room and our rate included a continental breakfast which was not bad. During the weekend the bar is very lively. I will return to this hotel in my future visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Donto
Reviews.Content: Montreal is such a great city and we visit it every year for the Jazz festival. This hotel has got a superb location- close to the downtown action but also right close to some of the best restaurants in the Vieux Port. Location aside, my wife and I love the chic and trendy feel of the hotel. One of our annual getaway spots.

Reviews.Title: “Best-in-class service at coolest hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: LeKing14
Reviews.Content: Hotel St-Paul is a rare gem. Our organization was used to traditional hotel chains in downtown areas, so the hotel's location, nestled discreetly in the heart of Old Montreal, was the first sign that this conference was going to be special. While the building's exterior says classic architecture, the interior is modern cool with a designer/rock-n-roll feel. The unique 'fire' & "ice" themed floor plans and "earth" & "sky" themed guest rooms have to be seen to be appreciated -- and they have to be seen! Featuring various combinations of canopies, hardwood floors, fur throws and soaker tubs, guest rooms were unlike any we had experienced recently. Cuisine at the upscale Vauvert restaurant was simply to-die-for. However, the biggest high-light of our 2-day/2-night event was the outsanding hotel staff. Personable and passionate about what they do, they made us feel like we were the most important guests in the world. How can you top that?

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Radchap
Reviews.Content: I stayed in St Pauls hotel recently and would probably never stay there again. The reception and service was great ! The internet is free and fast ! The layout and interior design of the hotel is too dark and uncomfortable. This is definitely not a hotel for families ! The furniture is too modern and uncomfortable. The bar downstairs is too loud and club-like. I couldnt find a lounge to relax in the evenings. We ended up in Sofitel for some drinks. Limited room service ! nothing after 1130 pm. Lastly, the hotel is on the outskirts of Old Montreal ( a bit too close for a cab but not close enough to walk) . I have stayed in Downtown Montreal before and would prefer to stay in Sofitel again ! That said , the service is really good ! wish the bed was comfortable !

Reviews.Title: “Chic, environmentally friendly hotel w/wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarieChristine54
Reviews.Content: Modern style, yet warm and inviting rooms. From the moment you arrive, the staff welcome you warmly and go above and beyond to make your stay an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & great location near Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Greyman44
Reviews.Content: Stand out service by a young team. Excellent location next to Old Montreal and within walking distance to central business district. The reason for selecting this hotel was its location and availability of two double beds in some rooms. The valet parking service for $22.00 per day was welcome.The modern decor is a bit stark and overpowering with its black walls and ceilings but the rooms are clean and well presented but not luxurious. The bar area and restaurant on the ground floor appear to be a favorite meeting place for young Montreal businessmen and women.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: 008films
Reviews.Content: An amazing experience from the moment someone opens the door for you, to the point of checking out. When you step into this hotel you can see it has a very elegant approach; a fireplace with a lounge, a contemporary bar/restaurant; even the smells are very inviting. The room make you want to move in and live there! Unbelievable bath-tub!!! The service is very welcoming and hospitable and it comes very natural, nothing forced or fake. The location is perfect and easily accessible; walk to all of the old Montreal boutique shops and restaurants.........simply amazing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: antoineparis_10
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the St Paul for the professionalism of the Staff, the perfectly clean room, the relaxing atmosphere, the very unique architecture of the hotel. My stay was very enjoyable and I particularly appreciate to be minutes from everything in Town : metro, museums, Old Port, Old Montreal, downtown, nice restaurants. All in all, as I said, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jamesgva
Reviews.Content: I stay here with some frequency and it really is like being home. The staff are great and most have been around for a while. The bar is a hotspot on Thurs' and Sat's. Free breakfast and wifi. And style. Lot's of style. It's in a great area, at the edge of the old port district, with lots of restos and bars nearby. As for all the basic hotel-y things -- comfy beds, welcoming lobby, biz center, etc -- the st paul has them. The cons? Small gym, no pool. As a boutique hotel, no loyalty program. And no chance for a quick and low-key dinner on the aforementioned Thurs' and Sat's, not even through room service. But, in total, these are very minor things.

Reviews.Title: “it was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RanangMontreal
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel!The staff is welcoming and the rooms are simply irrestibles! We particularly enjoyed the evening sponsored by smirnoff (after our supper) with DJ , and dancefloor at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: shincbends
Reviews.Content: The old city of Montreal is where you want to be and that's where the St.Paull is ! Look, most hotels are all the same... you can stand in a major hotel chain lobby and you could be anywhere in the world, they all look the same. The St.Paul is not like like. Standing in their lobby, you know that you're in Canada and you know that you're in Montreal. This hotel has lovely large windows.. everywhere. It has a lovely staff.. in fact, the ladies in their dinning room are all about six feet tall with dresses that are SO short you can hardly look at your food.. not kidding, it's so distracting that you must remind yourself to eat. The hotel staff do their job well. They are genuinely shocked to hear that it's your first time visitng the St. Paul; they must have may repeat customers. As you've read thoughout the review, the rooms are nicely appointed, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are modern. We were on the 8th floor and that meant quiet... is Montreal ever loud? While there is no dance floor in the bar, it hops on Friday and Saturday night. And if your reading this from the United States, and you've never been to Montreal.. let me tell you... Ladies bring your bling and dresses gents bring your sports jacket.. Evening in Montreal.. everyone dresses up.. espcially at the St. Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Happy customers”
Reviews.Author: Manuesaq
Reviews.Content: I've started bringing our clients to the St-Paul hotel 3 years ago. This is when I discovered this great hotel. The employees offer an incredible service and the hotel has one of the best location an hotel can have in Montreal. All our clients, coming from everywhere around the world, have always been happy with their stay. The Vauvert restaurant which is located in the hotel is also one of the best place for a 5 to 7 or to go out on Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: prevostf
Reviews.Content: SUPER! Pleasant environment. Large room with two televisions - Suite 505. Excellent restaurant for dinner! Lunch pleasant, smooth and fresh! Thank you for the concierge service. Many ideas I will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful Area”
Reviews.Author: cricri99
Reviews.Content: Last October I stayed at the St Paul Hotel in Old Montreal with my family and we had a wonderful time in a such beautiful hotel. The beautiful outside old facade contrast a lot with the design interior, but it makes the hotel much more interesting and attractive. The staff was available and very friendly. Our suite was very cosy, trendy and spotlessly clean. Old Montreal is fabulous, it was the perfect place to enjoy holidays in family. I would definitely come back to the St Paul for my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “worth the location. the rest? meh”
Reviews.Author: pepsint
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend getaway to Montreal over the easter break and spent 2 nights at the Hotel St. Paul. The best thing about this hotel is the location. We were able to walk to most of our destinations- and a big bonus was the ability to come back to the room for rest between outings. We were somewhat unimpressed with the hotel decor. It's sparse- going for the 'chic' look. BUT- it was functional- you had everything you need. The staff is wonderful. Though- I will say this, the room was not cleaned to the standard I would expect out of a hotel. The bed was made, but that was about the extent of the "cleaning". As to the debate about the beds- yes, they are hard...but they are also very comfortable. we slept well. The breakfast was great. It is the perfect way to start the day. Overall a good experience. Would I stay there again? maybe if the price was right, but I'd most likely try somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay for business and leisure - Location and value excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mat_EPSI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel St-Paul for 2 nights and my experience was ideally. The location is perfect; the area is very nice and close to everything. The service was impeccable, I was received by the Hotel manager who is very nice and treats his client in a professional manner. I would suggest it to everyone, especially for business travellers. I will certainly stay there on my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in Luxurious Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: TravelsFirstClass
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel were welcoming, professional and effective. We had a suite, which was luxurious, spacious and catered to leisure and business. I really liked the small touches like a small box chocolates, newspapers and bottles of water on a beautiful dark brown wood tray and the original presentation in the bathroom. The hotel is situated in the old port, great for restaurents and shopping. You can litterally walk out of the hotel in any direction and find something to please. It is also very near to the metro station, which is great when you want to explore a little bit more of Montreal. What I liked best about the hotel was the luxury and service, what I liked least was that no tea or hot chocolate is made available in the rooms with the coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of the many i have visited”
Reviews.Author: shawnti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled extensively for business and pleasure from Brussels, San Francisco, Miami and beyond, and this is the best hotel we have visited. The service is excellent and given with great smiles from staff like Nora, Claudia, Mike and Pietro. The location is excellent and in easy walking of distance of great restaurants, the old town and the commercial district. Reg Bedell Attorney at Law

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, run by very well trained and warm staff”
Reviews.Author: dczaja
Reviews.Content: I travel around the world for my business and pleasure; the St. Paul in Montreal is extremely good value. You will not be disappointed with any aspect of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Going boutique without breaking the bank!”
Reviews.Author: wesleynb
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about our stay at this hotel. The Hotel St. Paul balances minimalism and warmth in both style and vibe. The staff is incredibly friendly and eager to please. Rooms are small but offer an edgy urban decor and very comfortable beds. The beautiful hotel restaurant and bar is a late-night hotspot on Friday and Saturday. Finally, Hotel St. Paul serves a lovely continental breakfast daily which is an added benefit in an expensive city like Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Just satisfied....”
Reviews.Author: BBora
Reviews.Content: Was expecting somewhat more from St.Paul. Staff were excellent and went out of their way to be helpful. Great location in Old Montreal. Room was a little small and basic for the price, although very clean. May stay there again depending on the price, lots of alternatives in the 4-star category.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: vlukewi
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself recently stayed at the St Paul with another couple for three days, two nights. We each had a room on the 9th floor. The positive aspects: -The rooms were clean -The hotel is located fairly close to the tourist area of Old Montreal The negative aspects: -The breakfast was non existant. There was no food, no cups, no cutlery, no dishes, no coffee, no tea, no staff refilling ANYTHING, etc etc. They should not advertise "breakfast included" -We were not told that they charge extra $$ for parking until we were checking out and given a bill for $12 per day! -Our internet connection did not work in either room throughout our entire stay and they did not fix the problem when it was reported to the front desk -The rooms were BOILING hot, and the thermostat didn't really seem to help. (We only discovered that the windows open on our last day.) -Our TV remote didn't work To summarize, this hotel is trendy, but it lacks substance. Although we still had a great time in Montreal, we will not stay at the St Paul again, and we do not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to be in Montreal ! Very Elegant, Impeccable service, Great location !”
Reviews.Author: JLPParis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a unique caractere, unique location (in the old Montreal) : furniture is simply amazing / elegant : all rooms are differents and you really feel like beeing at home, the staff is very friendly and efficient, the restaurant is good (great dishes) and the bar is also a very nice place to relax . We stayed 5 days with the entire family (3 kids) and we would really recommand this hotel for both leisure or business trips.

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in Montreal, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: NIC98000
Reviews.Content: The St-Paul is one of the best boutique hotel in Montreal. Staff is incredible and very helpful. The service is personalized and every body is on top of its work. Thank you Valerie for the welcome note in the room. Thank you Ali for swamping everybody with good mood and professionalism. A great stay and a strong recommendation for: 1/ Staff 2/Location (best location in the Old Port) 3/ restaurant (Vauvert is the Hot Spot on Thrsday night)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room and great service!”
Reviews.Author: beaunancy13
Reviews.Content: Stayed over one night in the most gorgeous suite - ate at the restaurant in the hotel (Vauvert) and took advantage of the breakfast (delicious) - loved every minute of my stay. The location of this hotel is perfect - in the old historical part of Montreal - walking distance to shops and great restaurants. Service was great and loved the nice touches (water bottles, delicious chocolates). You will not be dissapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Vanguard in a classic setting”
Reviews.Author: sgentzsch
Reviews.Content: Set in the historic district of Montreal, close to all the great sights, the contemporary hotels offers everything a person could need. The staff is attentive (we travelled with your young son) and always had good recommendations/tips to provide us. The restaurant is also impecable- Thursday nights are a great scene! Any of my friends thinking of going I recommend they stay at the St Paul!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: arakiwi
Reviews.Content: The St Paul hotel is located in old Montreal, in a beautiful building. We got a free upgrade, for a very pleasant suite facing the street but without any noise. The bathroom was spacious with a huge tub and very good quality products. You even have an umbrella in the room just in case. The Staff was friendly and there are two restaurants: one at the 2nd floor where you can enjoy a nice breakfast on cosy sofas if you wish, and another one on the first floor with an independent bar. The only complaint would be about the corridors too dark. We definitely had a good time there, and we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: mzplacedinphilly
Reviews.Content: I recently completed two weeks at the Hotel St Paul on a business trip. Since my stay was broken up by a trip home I stayed in two different rooms. While I liked the first room set up better, I have no major complaints with either. I found this hotel can indeed be polarizing. A number of colleagues were staying at the hotel at the same time. One opted to move to another hotel they thought it was "too dark", the remainder stayed. Lobby/room and overall atmosphere is modern/industrial so if you are looking for chintz/cozy, better to look elsewhere. A warm fire and gracious hotel staff greeted me upon arrival. Hallways are extremely dark with each door illuminated similar to what I have seen in W chain. Multiple lighting options are available in each room too allow for both mood or bright lighting so lighting is not an issue in rooms. The first floorplan I had put the desk up against banquette seating which was a more comfortable workspace for me personally. The second room was similar in size but put the desk up against a wall and had a larger dressing area in entry with banquette which I found to be a bit of wasted space. Bathrooms are large and spacious with excellent counterspace and lighting. I found both rooms to be clean and modern minimalist in design. I did find the bed a bit harder than my preferance, but in all fairness I sleep on a monster featherbed at home which can rarely be be duplicated via hotel experience. No issues with internet connection. Room service menu is somewhat limited but I found no bad choices were made with my selections. Continental breakfast protein options were limited to hard boiled eggs - no meat options whatsoever - however what was provided was fresh with a huge bread and cheese selection. Staff was courteous and helpful through every phase of my stay. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Warmly Modern and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Gottakeepgoin
Reviews.Content: Just wrapped up a 4 night/5 day stay at Hotel St Paul. Staff were really nice and very helpful. The hotel was the most modern that I've personally stayed in though it still felt warm and cozy. It's on the cusp of Old Montreal so you don't get the same obnoxious & noisy tourist pedestrian traffic at night like other hotels experiences I've had in the area. The continental breakfast was the right amount of food and selection to make four days breakfast not feel the same day in and day out. Fantastic location made it easy to get quite a lot done during what felt like not a long enough trip! Close proximity to local transit, spas, shopping, across the river from the casino, bars, clubs and fabulous restaurants made doing a lot stress free and unrushed. The windows open to allow fresh air in - that's rare and I loved it!!! Adored it, will stay again and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with style and quality service”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler10
Reviews.Content: came to Montreal to check out the city from San Diego. I booked directly thru the front desk and while the process was a bit challenging at first it finished on a very strong note. gave me a fair room rate and the room I requested. design is strong, a tiny bit dated but overall enjoyed the feel of the hotel. the bar scene was worth the stay as well. part of the experience in staying in a hotel of this nature is the common area and the scene that comes with it. Housekeeping was very good, nice guest amenities in the rooms, turn down service, etc. breakfast was solid and good. location is great. Old Montreal is a nice area to walk. several good restaurants in the area. I would return and would suggest a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Very Shabby...”
Reviews.Author: makis1
Reviews.Content: Not for the discerning Boutique hotel lover. Firts of all I've stayed here 4 times... I come from NY drop about 1000 bucks for a 2 nights stay and keep telling myself never again. (Everything else was booked) Good: Availability (u can guess why) Issues: Never a doorman... i mean never... holy security issue batman Need another bottle of champagne in the room after 11pm? Sorry it's locked up Some rooms feel like you are in a shoebox... aesthetic more than size Cheap crappy lounge restaurant... "Sorry cant take the 2 - 60 dollar glasses of champagne to your room because we might lose the glasses" "Ill return them"... "sorry"... really suburban crowed... read. too much hair gel and muscle shirts with cheap shoes. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse for Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanntu
Reviews.Content: When you check in to a boutique hotel, you look for the finer things in life to make your stay more enjoyable, but most of all, you expect impeccable service because, after all, you pay a little more for a whole lot...right? No, but top notch service will definately make up for where detail is dropped. It was just OK. No king size beds, so dimly lit you know they are hiding the poor paint job. Furniture was old, worn, and torn (common breakfast area on the 2nd floor). It was really smoke and mirrors. Not once did a doorman open the door for you and no one smiled and said "hello". I felt like I was bothering the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St Paul - Overrated - Very Hard Bed”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkStoneman
